snippet: A lawsuit challenges a rule requiring proof of citizenship that has left thousands of people — many of them young and first-time voters — listed as incomplete registrants.
abstract: Move by Kansas officials to cull names from voter registration list pits Republican secretary of state, Kris W Kobach, against Democrats and voters' rights advocates; Kobach is named in lawsuit by plaintiffs who now, under law that went into effect in 2013, must provide proof of American citizenship in order to register to vote; voting rights advocates say law is similar to voter identification laws passed in about 12 Republican-led states since 2011, and is intended to suppress voter turnout, particularly among low-income and minority voters.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit challenges a rule requiring proof of citizenship that has left thousands of people — many of them young and first-time voters — listed as incomplete registrants.

headline.print_headline: Voter ID Battle Shifts to Kansas
headline.main: Voter ID Battle Shifts to Kansas
